summary:
I am an experienced ICT Consultant with a solid background in industrial automation, manufacturing, logistics, GIS/GPS and finance. I’m looking for a challenging position, where my leadership and technical capabilities can be applied.

With "hands-on" software development for global manufacturing, test and logistics, I gained experience with the entire hardware and software production life cycle for a Fortune 500 company. In more recent positions I acted as an engineering lead/manager on projects focused on industrial automation and factory infrastructure. The attention to quality originates from my focus on test automation in high revenue production facilities. 

In my last assignments I worked in consultancy on an internal cloud solution and on test automation for mobile communication for a military GIS and navigation application. I prefer to work in agile teams in a high tech environment.

During the period he worked in the UK, I learned to work with people from different culture. I’m a team player and am able to effectively communicate at different levels of the organization. Because of that I’m able to build bridges between the business and IT and formulate a clear vision on future architecture.

publications.name: Met je hoofd in de Wolken (Head in the cloud)

profile_positions.description: Worked on various contracts for Bol, Meyn, Thales and Ministry of Defence described in below sections;
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Context & Objectives
A proposal was accepted to insource the IT management of the production control equipment from their supplier TGW. The Bol.com warehouse contains ~3 km of conveyer belt, that connects the various package handing stations for both inbound and outbound. The resistance against this change at TGW side had to be managed.

Approach & Achievements
Most of of the development and governance processes are defined for the new hardware environment. The requirements have been analysed and documented. A proposal was prepared for modification of the contract with TGW. A test administration system was setup and a first start was made in test automation. A simulator was introduced at BOL’s test environments and that helped to setup an integrated Acceptance environment for end-to-end testing.

Results & Added value
•	The go-live of the new infra was successful.
•	The new infra and way of working resulted in much less downtime.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Context & Objectives
At Alfa Laval the product development process needs to be improved in various area’s. For the PureSoX product this has resulted in a significant loss of revenue due to costs of non-conformance at customer sites. A solution needed to be found, that would fix products and motivate customers to start paying their bills for the product and service again.

Approach & Achievements
The costs of quality for the current situation was quantified and used to convince management of the magnitude of their problem. A proposal to administrate and manage the test, requirements, bugs and work packages process was accepted. Test automation for system test and integration tests was initiated and a start was made with introduction of structured unit test.

Results & Added value
Savings of around 2 M$ on an annual basis when customers start paying their bills and a higher quality level of the products and services supplied.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Context & Objectives
Meyn was in the process of releasing a generic reporting module for their production line product and needed help with testing their application in an automated manner. 

Approach & Achievements
An automated test suite was developed and a proposal was made for improvements in the development process preceding the test, since most of the causes for non-conformance initiated from that.

Results & Added value
The test suite was used during production and the proposal were not honored.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Context & Objectives
At the Ministry of Defense, all 170 locations will be equipped with new security equipment. All equipment will be controlled by a central control room. Intervention team's communication and positioning is handled from this control room using mobile devices. Ard-Jan had a leading role in the team that is responsible for automated deployment, configuration and maintenance of the complete IT infrastructure of software, datacenters, controllers, camera's, card readers, actuators etc.

Approach & Achievements
We used the ERP product "Windchill" to define the static hardware and software installation and ServiceNow for the more specific configuration parameter definition. Ansible was used to orchestrate the deployment, with Powershell, ksh, python, Java, Selenium and Sikuli as supporting languages. Jenkins was used to define the CI chain, with Bitbucket, Git, Jira, PyUnit, Junit, Maven and Nexus. 

Results & Added value
Savings of around 16 M on an investment of 4M comparing manual v.s. automated deployment and testing.
profile_positions.title: System Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Context & Objectives
Migration from a batch to a real-time payment system

Approach & Achievements
•	Chairman of Test Architecture team.
•	Test automation for Payment systeem.
•	non-functional testing
•	Development in C#, Bash en Mumps.
Results & Added value
•	Delivery of the Payment engine for Loans and savings.
•	Leadtime for customer payments down to seconds instead of a day.
•	Delivery of Continuous integration for Testware
profile_positions.title: DevOps Engineer

profile_positions.description:
The vision for the ongoing project Elias is to provide a common operational view of the battlefield for al staff, that is involved in a particular mission. The application is centered around a GIS/navigation application. A map of the environment provides all relevant information by location. In addition to that Elias is used for the chain of command, issuing orders and fire missions. It's also integrated to all sensory data from each vehicle an it communicates encrypted data using various communication protocols and media transmitters. 

responsibilities:
- Test lead for the sub-project "Data Framework" (communication layer)
- Provide requirements for the test architecture maintenance department
- Maintenance of the simulation tool "Virtual Node service"
- Analysis of daily test results
- Proposal for Model Based Testing
profile_positions.title: Senior Test Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Prorail plans to improve the safety of the employees that work on the rail tracks, with the use of a handheld gps device. This device should "early warn" employees for trains, that are likely to be in the path of the employee. My assignment was to research possible GPS devices in the market and research the feasibility and suitability of these devices for this purpose.

responsibilities:
- Feasibility study for using GPS devices for rails road worker safety
profile_positions.title: Information analyst

profile_positions.description:
I was added to the "emergency team" that was tasked to turn this project around, since it that had gone into a steep nose dive. We managed to turn the project into a huge success, as it came in second best IT project of the Netherlands competition and achieved  a 5 SIG start rating (top 5%). This was partly due to a drastic change in the test architecture and approach.

The aim of this project was to automate the administrative process around delivering small packages at the home address. To do so, the DHL database was connected to the SelektVracht database and ported to a Windows Mobile handheld application.

responsibilities:
- Test management
- Test automation
profile_positions.title: Senior Test Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The Credit risk management department of the ING bank collects a huge amount of very diverse data. Each data element is, in some way, of influence to the amount of risk ING takes, by starting a loan for a particular customer. The Vortex application analyses this data on a daily basis using a complex algorithm. The resulting risk ratings are distributed across ING on a daily basis. 

As a test automation specialist I worked on the automated test system for theVortex Big data application. This test environment was command line based and ran in a Unix environment. The test application was mainly written in C shell and used SQL to determine pass/fail situations. For each new Vortex release a test plan and risk analysis was made. Test administration and traceability was done using Quality Center. I developed a test scheduler for migration to keyword based testing.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Test automation engineer

profile_positions.description: I was a senior test lead for setup of test architecture for ING internet banking and worked in three teams. The first team worked on migration plans from Quality Center to the Rational life cycle management suite. The second team focused on the introduction of test automation and we decided on the use of Selenium for GUI testing. The last team developed a simulation tool for the testing of core components that did not have a GUI.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Test automation engineer
